article:
'Judgement' (or 'judgment' [http://www.wsu.edu/~brians/errors/judgement.html
Judgement or Judgment?] - Choices in terminological spelling and usage. )
is the evaluation of evidence in the making of a
decision. [http://dictionary.cambridge.org/define.asp?key=43009&dict=CALD
Cambridge
Dictionary] [http://www.askoxford.com/concise_oed/judgement?view=uk
AskOxford.com] [http://www.ldoceonline.com/dictionary/judgement
LDOCEonline] The term has four distinct uses:
* Informal - Opinions expressed as facts.
* Informal and psychological â used in reference to the quality of cognitive
  faculties and adjudicational capabilities of particular individuals, typically
  called [[wisdom]] or [[discernment]].
* Legal â used in the context of legal trial, to refer to a final finding,
  statement, or ruling, based on a considered weighing of evidence, called
  "[[adjudication]]". See spelling note for further explanation.
* Religious â used in the concept of salvation to refer to the [[divine
  judgement|adjudication of God]] in determining Heaven or Hell for each and all
  human beings.
